body_html: Interesting ... when training models for real (i.e. where time-to-accuracy is often more important than step-time), people often deliberately introduce noise and random distortions after decoding the image, so I can't imagine this would hurt!
body_text: Interesting ... when training models for real (i.e. where time-to-accuracy is often more important than step-time), people often deliberately introduce noise and random distortions after decoding the image, so I can't imagine this would hurt!
body: Interesting ... when training models for real (i.e. where time-to-accuracy is often more important than step-time), people often deliberately introduce noise and random distortions after decoding the image, so I can't imagine this would hurt!
